title: 2024 United States presidential election
deleted: =====Other potential candidates=====
*** Potential candidates must have at least TWO separate references from reliable sources that focus primarily on them as a potential candidate

*** Sources should provide substantive discussion of individuals, not a "kitchen sink" listing of numerous people or a minor sentence saying they could possibly run, or where the candidate themselves talks about the 2024 race
*** Sources should be no older than 6 months
As of February 2021, the following people have been subjects of speculation about their potential candidacy within the previous six months.

* [[Greg Abbott]], [[Governor of Texas]] (2015–present)<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.kxan.com/news/texas-politics/gov-greg-abbott-on-2024-presidential-bid-well-see-what-happens/|title=Gov. title: 2024 United States presidential election
added: =====Publicly expressed interest=====
As of February 2021, individuals in this section have expressed an interest in running for president within the previous six months.
*** Candidates in this section only need one source, but expressions of interest via social media do not count
*** Sources in this section can go back a maximum of six months

* [[Dan Bongino]], commentator, radio host; Republican nominee for Senate in [[2012 United States Senate election in Maryland|2012]], nominee for House of Representatives in [[2014 United States House of Representatives elections in Maryland#District 6|2014]] and candidate in [[2016 United States House of Representatives elections in Florida#District 19|2016]]<ref>{{cite web |last1=Petrizzo |first1=Zachary |title=Dan Bongino Floats 2024 Presidential Bid If Trump Isn't On The Ballot: 'I Will Consider Entering Politics Again' |url=https://www.mediaite.com/news/dan-bongino-floats-2024-presidential-bid-if-trump-isnt-on-the-ballot-i-will-consider-entering-politics-again/ |website=Mediaite|date=November 23, 2020|access-date=November 23, 2020}}</ref>

* [[Chris Christie]], [[Governor of New Jersey]] (2010–2018); [[Chris Christie 2016 presidential campaign|candidate]] for president in [[2016 Republican Party presidential primaries|2016]]<ref>{{Cite web|last=Fitz-Gibbon|first=Jorge|date=December 22, 2020|title=Chris Christie considering a presidential run in 2024|url=https://nypost.com/2020/12/22/chris-christie-considering-2024-run-would-challenge-trump/|access-date=December 22, 2020|website=New York Post|language=en-US}}</ref>

* [[Tom Cotton]], [[United States Senate|U.S. Senator]] from [[Arkansas]] (2015–present)<ref>{{cite web|url=https://theweek.com/articles/958720/tom-cotton-gambit-win-republican-future|title=The Tom Cotton gambit to win the Republican future|website=The Week|last1=Linker|first1=Damon|date=January 6, 2021|access-date=February 2, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wmur.com/article/sen-tom-cotton-of-arkansas-tells-nh-republicans-hell-be-back-to-state-very-very-soon/35298479|title=Sen. =====Other potential candidates=====
*** Potential candidates must have at least TWO separate references from reliable sources that focus primarily on them as a potential candidate

*** Sources should provide substantive discussion of individuals, not a "kitchen sink" listing of numerous people or a minor sentence saying they could possibly run, or where the candidate themselves talks about the 2024 race
*** Sources should be no older than 6 months
As of February 2021, the following people have been subjects of speculation about their potential candidacy within the previous six months.

* [[Greg Abbott]], [[Governor of Texas]] (2015–present)<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.kxan.com/news/texas-politics/gov-greg-abbott-on-2024-presidential-bid-well-see-what-happens/|title=Gov. title: 2024 United States presidential election
deleted: If former president [[Donald Trump]] decides to run in 2024 and wins, he would seek to become the second president after [[Grover Cleveland]] to serve non-consecutive terms. The last one-term president to campaign for a second non-consecutive term was [[Herbert Hoover]], who after serving from 1929 to 1933 made runs in [[1936 United States presidential election|1936]] and [[1940 United States presidential election|1940]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Baker |first1=Peter |title=Trump Hints at Another Act in Four Years, Just Like Grover Cleveland|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/02/us/politics/trump-2024.html |access-date=December 6, 2020 |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=December 2, 2020}}</ref> Trump remains eligible following the results of his [[Second impeachment trial of Donald Trump|second impeachment trial]], following the [[2021 storming of the U.S. Capitol]], and the resulting [[Second impeachment trial of Donald Trump|second impeachment]], in which he was acquitted by the senate and therefore did not trigger a separate vote barring him from holding a state or federal office in the future.

In the 2020 election, Biden was the oldest person ever elected to the presidency, while Trump was the oldest candidate ever to seek reelection.<ref name=Forbes11092020>{{cite magazine| title=Biden Set To Become The Oldest President In U.S. History| last=McCarthy| first=Niall| date=November 9, 2020| url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/niallmccarthy/2020/11/09/biden-set-to-become-the-oldest-president-in-us-history-infographic/?sh=105580cb7be6| magazine=[[Forbes]]|access-date=January 27, 2021}}</ref> If both candidates are the nominees in 2024, they will therefore extend their records for being the oldest candidates for the office.

title: 2024 United States presidential election
added: *** Potential candidates must have at least TWO separate references from reliable sources that focus primarily on them as a potential candidate

*** Sources should provide substantive discussion of individuals, not a "kitchen sink" listing of numerous people or a minor sentence saying they could possibly run, or where the candidate themselves talks about the 2024 race
*** Sources should be no older than 6 months
As of March 2021, the following people have been subjects of speculation about their potential candidacy within the previous six months.
